headline: Dow Retreats on Financials Weakness. Nasdaq Rises 0.3%.
summary: A heavy slide in financial stocks pushed the Dow lower on Friday, cementing a second consecutive weekly decline for the blue-chip index.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.6%, or 274 points, on Friday.  The S&P 500 was flat while the Nasdaq Composite gained 0.3%.

headline: Goldman CEO David Solomon Paid $47 Million
summary: Goldman Sachs awarded Chief Executive David Solomon $47 million in compensation for 2025, a 21% raise from the prior year for posting the second-best results in the bank’s history.  The majority is in stock-based compensation tied to future performance.  Goldman’s revenue and profit both rose in 2025 and were second only to the 2021 deal boom.
